channel.title: The Devpost Commit
channel.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Hiring, hackers, hackathons
channel.description: Devpost's weekly show about software developers, hackathons, and getting a job in tech. Hosted by Richard Murby and Neal Shyam. New episodes hit the street every Thursday!
channel.itunes:summary: Devpost's weekly show about software developers, hackathons, and getting a job in tech. Hosted by Richard Murby and Neal Shyam. New episodes hit the street every Thursday!

item.title: How hackathons can help your career
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: ft. Eric Wu from hackNY
item.itunes:summary: We like to talk about hackathons because they‚Äôre fun. And of course, there‚Äôs the ‚Äúpizza, caffeine, and staying up late‚Äù stereotype. But, hackathons can help your career & personal development. On today‚Äôs episode of The Commit, HackNY Director Eric Wu shares some lessons from over 10 years of hackathoning.
item.description: We like to talk about hackathons because they‚Äôre fun. And of course, there‚Äôs the ‚Äúpizza, caffeine, and staying up late‚Äù stereotype. But, hackathons can help your career & personal development. On today‚Äôs episode of The Commit, HackNY Director Eric Wu shares some lessons from over 10 years of hackathoning.

item.title: How to find a mentor
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: ft. Rob Spectre from Twilio
item.itunes:summary: 9 out of 10 Medium posts agree: you need a mentor. But what do career mentors actually do? How will they help you become a better developer? And how do you even find one? Twilio‚Äôs Rob Spectre joins us to answer the tough questions!
item.description: 9 out of 10 Medium posts agree: you need a mentor. But what do career mentors actually do? How will they help you become a better developer? And how do you even find one? Twilio‚Äôs Rob Spectre joins us to answer the tough questions!

item.title: New job milestones
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Day 1, Week 1, Quarter 1
item.itunes:summary: You got the job. Congrats! Now, do you know what to expect on your first day? How about during your first week, month, or quarter? Watch this week‚Äôs Commit to learn about major milestones for a new junior Rails developer.
item.description: You got the job. Congrats! Now, do you know what to expect on your first day? How about during your first week, month, or quarter? Watch this week‚Äôs Commit to learn about major milestones for a new junior Rails developer.

item.title: What's the difference between Junior & Senior developers?
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's more than just bigger paychecks, right?
item.itunes:summary:
Today we‚Äôre sitting down with our CTO Matt Gerrior to discuss the differences between Junior and Senior developers. Remember, years of experience is just a number. As Matt explains, Seniors exhibit ownership and take a proactive team view, while Juniors should focus on learning about the product, so they can contribute to it.
We‚Äôll talk about duties / responsibilities, character traits, and answer some common other common questions. Hope you dig it!
item.description:
Today we‚Äôre sitting down with our CTO Matt Gerrior to discuss the differences between Junior and Senior developers. Remember, years of experience is just a number. As Matt explains, Seniors exhibit ownership and take a proactive team view, while Juniors should focus on learning about the product, so they can contribute to it.

We‚Äôll talk about duties / responsibilities, character traits, and answer some common other common questions. Hope you dig it!

item.title: Solving the Battleship interview question
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Forget FizzBuzz - this is way more fun
item.itunes:summary:
Last week‚Äôs episode about technical interview was a hit, so we asked Kevin to come back and show us how to solve a common hypothetical interview question. He suggested one of his favorites: programming the classic board game Battleship.
There are three parts to the solution: rules & assumptions, setup (placing ships on the board), and missile firing (calculating hits). Got questions? Post them on YouTube!
item.description:
Last week‚Äôs episode about technical interview was a hit, so we asked Kevin to come back and show us how to solve a common hypothetical interview question. He suggested one of his favorites: programming the classic board game Battleship.

There are three parts to the solution: rules & assumptions, setup (placing ships on the board), and missile firing (calculating hits). Got questions? Post them on YouTube!

item.title: How to ace technical interviews
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: 3 common interview questions
item.itunes:summary:
Don‚Äôt let technical interviews stress you out - they‚Äôre your chance to show off all your awesome problem solving skills. In this week‚Äôs Commit, Metric Collective‚Äôs CTO Kevin Dolan lays out 3 types of common interview questions (quizzes, experience, hypotheticals) and how to approach them. üîëüîëüîë
Next week, Richard and Kevin will be back to hit the whiteboard!

Don‚Äôt let technical interviews stress you out - they‚Äôre your chance to show off all your awesome problem solving skills. item.title: What are stock options?
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Options, grants, vesting, cliffs, more!
item.itunes:summary:
An important part of evaluating a startup job offer is understanding your stock options. This week on the Commit, our CEO Brandon Kessler has some great tips that‚Äôll get you past the jargon and the hype.
Things we‚Äôll discuss: stock options, grants, vesting periods, strike price, exercising your options, liquidity events, IPOs, and acquisitions.
item.description:
An important part of evaluating a startup job offer is understanding your stock options. This week on the Commit, our CEO Brandon Kessler has some great tips that‚Äôll get you past the jargon and the hype.

Things we‚Äôll discuss: stock options, grants, vesting periods, strike price, exercising your options, liquidity events, IPOs, and acquisitions.

item.title: Developer job hunting crash course
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Everything you need to find a job
item.itunes:summary: Summer is a great time to find a job. Developer demand is high and supply is low ‚Äì but you have to be on top of your game. In this week‚Äôs show, we pulled together clips from some of our best guests / episodes to give you a crash course in job hunting.
item.description: Summer is a great time to find a job. Developer demand is high and supply is low ‚Äì but you have to be on top of your game. In this week‚Äôs show, we pulled together clips from some of our best guests / episodes to give you a crash course in job hunting.

item.title: Making mobile games at Small Planet
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: What do game developers actually do??
item.itunes:summary: Ever wonder what game developers do all day? Or if making games is different than making apps? This week on The Commit, we asked Taylor Plimpton, a Senior Developer at Small Planet (a digital agency in Brooklyn, NY), to share the ins and out of game development, tools & tech, dev process, what kind of input developers have on the final product, and more!
item.description: Ever wonder what game developers do all day? Or if making games is different than making apps? This week on The Commit, we asked Taylor Plimpton, a Senior Developer at Small Planet (a digital agency in Brooklyn, NY), to share the ins and out of game development, tools & tech, dev process, what kind of input developers have on the final product, and more!

item.title: Inside Justworks
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: How engineers and benefits specialists are working together to streamline Human Resources for small and mid-size businesses
item.itunes:summary:
This week, we went to Justworks to see how engineers and benefits specialists are working together to streamline Human Resources for small and mid-size business across America.
We learned about self-directed teams, culture, remote work (and robots!), the tech stack (Ruby on Rails, AWS, MySQL, Redshift, React), and more.
Want to join the team? Check out Justworks‚Äô team page: http://devpost.com/teams/justworks
item.description:
This week, we went to Justworks to see how engineers and benefits specialists are working together to streamline Human Resources for small and mid-size business across America.

We learned about self-directed teams, culture, remote work (and robots!), the tech stack (Ruby on Rails, AWS, MySQL, Redshift, React), and more.

Want to join the team? Check out Justworks‚Äô team page: http://devpost.com/teams/justworks

item.title: Portfolios and Mentorship with Rebecca Garcia
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Juice up your job hunt
item.itunes:summary: Rebecca Garcia joined us this week to drop some knowledge about what to highlight in your portfolio, mentorship, CoderDojo NYC, Passion x Purpose (her apprenticeship & mentorship program), and more.
item.description: Rebecca Garcia joined us this week to drop some knowledge about what to highlight in your portfolio, mentorship, CoderDojo NYC, Passion x Purpose (her apprenticeship & mentorship program), and more.

item.title: Jamchester Staff Picks
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our favorite entries from the UK's first major Game Jam
item.itunes:summary:
Just a quickie about our favorite entries from Jamchester, the UK‚Äôs first major Game Jam aimed at industry pros. The theme was ‚Äúyou‚Äôve already won,‚Äù which led to some awesome games.
Neal‚Äôs pick: Head Home
Richard‚Äôs pick: Last Man Standing
item.description:
Just a quickie about our favorite entries from Jamchester, the UK‚Äôs first major Game Jam aimed at industry pros. The theme was ‚Äúyou‚Äôve already won,‚Äù which led to some awesome games.

Neal‚Äôs pick: Head Home

Richard‚Äôs pick: Last Man Standing

item.title: Inside VTS
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Meet the developers at NYC's hottest real estate startup
item.itunes:summary:
This week, we went uptown to meet VTS, a startup building software for commercial real estate management.
We‚Äôll show you how the dev team is structured, VTS‚Äô full-stack approach to mobile, how much product input engineers have, what they‚Äôve learned about software development, and more.
Get the full scoop on VTS‚Äô open jobs in NYC, hiring process, and team by visiting their team page: http://devpost.com/teams/vts
item.description:

We‚Äôll show you how the dev team is structured, VTS‚Äô full-stack approach to mobile, how much product input engineers have, what they‚Äôve learned about software development, and more.

item.title: Don't sweat it with Cassidy Williams
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: How to conquer impostor syndrome and career tips
item.itunes:summary: Feeling anxious about finding a job? Relax, you‚Äôre awesome! But, if you need some tips, we got your back. This week, Clarifai‚Äôs Cassidy Williams joins us to chat about our Student Hacker Report, conquering impostor syndrome, and lots more.
item.description: Feeling anxious about finding a job? Relax, you‚Äôre awesome! But, if you need some tips, we got your back. This week, Clarifai‚Äôs Cassidy Williams joins us to chat about our Student Hacker Report, conquering impostor syndrome, and lots more.

item.title: Inside Digital Ocean
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Meet DO's developers and tour their office
item.itunes:summary:
In this week‚Äôs special episode, Richard went to DigitalOcean this week to learn about their dev team‚Äôs current projects, structure, culture (46% of the team is remote), and more. Watch our special and see what it‚Äôs like to work Inside Digital Ocean!
Want more information about DO‚Äôs hiring process, team, and open jobs? Visit their team page on Devpost.
item.description:
In this week‚Äôs special episode, Richard went to DigitalOcean this week to learn about their dev team‚Äôs current projects, structure, culture (46% of the team is remote), and more. Watch our special and see what it‚Äôs like to work Inside Digital Ocean!

Want more information about DO‚Äôs hiring process, team, and open jobs? Visit their team page on Devpost.

item.title: Decoding job listings Part 2
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Good job listings and what to focus on
item.itunes:summary:
Tech job listings can be pretty cringeworthy. Last week we showed you how to identify bad listings, so today we‚Äôll look at a better, more informative one. We‚Äôll show you how to quickly scan through a listing and what to focus on when you apply.
Staff picks: AlexaWebBot - Use Alexa to navigate and control any website & Bumperz - A dashcam that warns drivers about dangerous road conditions
item.description:
Tech job listings can be pretty cringeworthy. Last week we showed you how to identify bad listings, so today we‚Äôll look at a better, more informative one. We‚Äôll show you how to quickly scan through a listing and what to focus on when you apply.

Staff picks: AlexaWebBot - Use Alexa to navigate and control any website & Bumperz - A dashcam that warns drivers about dangerous road conditions

item.title: Decoding job listings Part 2
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Bonus: Let's plays from the Global Archiact Jam
item.itunes:summary:
Job listings are a hot mess. They mix requirements and benefits with statements like ‚Äúwe‚Äôre looking for passionate astro-coder-nauts for a rocket ride to the future.‚Äù But if you know how to read between the lines, you can quickly sift out good opportunities from bad ones.
We‚Äôve also got a special VR treat for you from Ryan Zehm and the Global Archiact Jam.
item.description:
Job listings are a hot mess. They mix requirements and benefits with statements like ‚Äúwe‚Äôre looking for passionate astro-coder-nauts for a rocket ride to the future.‚Äù But if you know how to read between the lines, you can quickly sift out good opportunities from bad ones.

We‚Äôve also got a special VR treat for you from Ryan Zehm and the Global Archiact Jam.

item.title: All about phone interview with Meetup
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:summary:
What‚Äôs a phone screen? (Hint: it comes before an interview, but after you apply) How do you prepare for it? What should you look out for? Meetup‚Äôs Jake Levine has all the answers in this week‚Äôs episode.
Staff picks: Money accordion - play the accordion using openCV + a dollar bill & EmotionPinTumbler - Emotion controlled locking mechanism
item.description:
What‚Äôs a phone screen? (Hint: it comes before an interview, but after you apply) How do you prepare for it? What should you look out for? Meetup‚Äôs Jake Levine has all the answers in this week‚Äôs episode.

Staff picks: Money accordion - play the accordion using openCV + a dollar bill & EmotionPinTumbler - Emotion controlled locking mechanism

item.title: How to not suck at job fairs
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:summary:
Richard‚Äôs been going to a lot of job fairs and he‚Äôs disappointed. Job seekers, you need to make a better effort and come prepared. But enough complaining, we‚Äôre here to help! So take our advice:
Prepare (Google the company before you walk up)
Engage (ask a question / make a suggestion)
Follow up up (email within 24 hours)
Staff picks: Stripr - 3D printed / configurable power strip & Alexa Keep - Store & retrieve anything with Alexa
item.description:
Richard‚Äôs been going to a lot of job fairs and he‚Äôs disappointed. Job seekers, you need to make a better effort and come prepared. But enough complaining, we‚Äôre here to help! So take our advice:

Prepare (Google the company before you walk up)

Engage (ask a question / make a suggestion)

Follow up up (email within 24 hours)

Staff picks: Stripr - 3D printed / configurable power strip & Alexa Keep - Store & retrieve anything with Alexa

item.title: The culture of fit with Meetup
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:summary:
Culture fit, like ‚Äúbusiness casual,‚Äù can be interpreted in many different ways. So for this week‚Äôs episode, we asked Meetup Engineering Manager Rich Hsieh to tell us what he looks for when evaluating developers.
We‚Äôve also got news about this weekend‚Äôs Fishackathon and some killer staff picks:
Autocolorization - Unleash your inner Ted Turner and colorize b&w movies with deep learning & Snapglasses - Design, print, and assemble your next pair of sunglasses
item.description:

item.title: Inside Devpost
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Meet our team, see our office, and be awesome
item.itunes:summary:
In this week‚Äôs special, we‚Äôre taking a look inside Devpost (that‚Äôs us!). You‚Äôll meet Holly & Matt, who are in charge of Product and Engineering, learn how we build products, and see where we work. There may even be some ping pong.
Visit our team page to learn more about Devpost, working on our team, and open positions.

In this week‚Äôs special, we‚Äôre taking a look inside Devpost (that‚Äôs us!). You‚Äôll meet Holly & Matt, who are in charge of Product and Engineering, learn how we build products, and see where we work. There may even be some ping pong.

Visit our team page to learn more about Devpost, working on our team, and open positions.

item.title: Quiltside chat with MLH
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jon and Shy talk about the spring hackathon season
item.itunes:summary:
Since we‚Äôre halfway through the spring hackathon season, we thought it‚Äôd be a good time to reflect. So, we sent Richard over to Major League Hacking for a ‚Äúquiltside chat‚Äù with Jon and Shy.
Projects mentioned: Fire in the Hole, Spin to Win, Record Printer
item.description:
Since we‚Äôre halfway through the spring hackathon season, we thought it‚Äôd be a good time to reflect. So, we sent Richard over to Major League Hacking for a ‚Äúquiltside chat‚Äù with Jon and Shy.

Projects mentioned: Fire in the Hole, Spin to Win, Record Printer

item.title: Get your hands dirty with Jade Misenas
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: Going from Hacker School to Clarifai
item.itunes:summary:
This week Richard talks to Jade from Clarifai about her experience at Hacker School. She tells us to get our hands dirty in code as we follow her from freelancing on WordPress themes to Hacker School to her latest gig at Clarifai.
We‚Äôve also got some great hardware hacks for you: QuikCaption and SecretSet.
item.description:
This week Richard talks to Jade from Clarifai about her experience at Hacker School. She tells us to get our hands dirty in code as we follow her from freelancing on WordPress themes to Hacker School to her latest gig at Clarifai.

We‚Äôve also got some great hardware hacks for you: QuikCaption and SecretSet.

item.title: Welcome (again) to Moviefone with David Burrick
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: How large orgs hire and build tech teams
item.itunes:summary:
Remember Moviefone? It was the original smart phone app (key word: phone). This week, AOL Moviefone General Manager, David Burrick stops by to talk about how large organizations hire, build tech teams, what hiring managers look for, and how to make your application stand out.
We‚Äôve also got some great hardware hacks for you: Alexa Jarvis and AR Watch.
item.description:
Remember Moviefone? It was the original smart phone app (key word: phone). This week, AOL Moviefone General Manager, David Burrick stops by to talk about how large organizations hire, build tech teams, what hiring managers look for, and how to make your application stand out.

We‚Äôve also got some great hardware hacks for you: Alexa Jarvis and AR Watch.

item.title: Vim vs. the world
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: The great text editor debate is on!
item.itunes:summary:
Neal wanted to call this week‚Äôs episode, Rumble in the RegEx, but Richard was like ‚ÄúNo, we‚Äôre gonna talk about text editors.‚Äù So yeah, we did a podcast about why we love Vim, Pico, Atom, and Sublime. But not Emacs.
Special guest appearances from Devpost engineer and Ronan Potage and Greenhouse engineer (and Devpost alum!) Juan M√ºller.
And of course, we‚Äôve got the greatest staff picks OF ALL TIME: Kanye Rest and Ramsay
item.description:

item.title: How to win bootcamp with Sarah Ransohoff
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: From Flatiron School to Venmo Engineer
item.itunes:summary:
This week, Venmo Engineer & Flatiron School grad Sarah Ransohoff talks about getting interested in tech, going to a bootcamp, getting the most of the experience, conquering frustration, focusing on learning, getting a gig, and more!
And as always, we‚Äôve got two great staff picks for you:
With Dreamote you can draw virtual buttons and use them to control a real Arduino with OpenCV.
Netra uses your phone and Clarifai to describe the world around you in real-time.
item.description:
This week, Venmo Engineer & Flatiron School grad Sarah Ransohoff talks about getting interested in tech, going to a bootcamp, getting the most of the experience, conquering frustration, focusing on learning, getting a gig, and more!

And as always, we‚Äôve got two great staff picks for you:

With Dreamote you can draw virtual buttons and use them to control a real Arduino with OpenCV.

Netra uses your phone and Clarifai to describe the world around you in real-time.

item.title: Cover letter hacks
item.itunes:author: Devpost Inc.
item.itunes:subtitle: You have to write them, might as well do it right!
item.itunes:summary:
This week, we‚Äôre focusing on everybody‚Äôs least favorite part of job hunting: COVER LETTERS! Brandon, our CEO, joins us to talk about why you need to them, what you should include, what will set yours apart, and what not to do.
We‚Äôve also got two great staff picks from SpartaHack: LearningLock, a neural network security layer for your Android and Wake, an alarm clock you can‚Äôt ignore.
item.description:
This week, we‚Äôre focusing on everybody‚Äôs least favorite part of job hunting: COVER LETTERS! Brandon, our CEO, joins us to talk about why you need to them, what you should include, what will set yours apart, and what not to do.

We‚Äôve also got two great staff picks from SpartaHack: LearningLock, a neural network security layer for your Android and Wake, an alarm clock you can‚Äôt ignore.
